metadata.title: CVE-2020-26951 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
A parsing and event loading mismatch in Firefox's SVG code could have allowed load events to fire, even after sanitization. An attacker already capable of exploiting an XSS vulnerability in privileged internal pages could have used this attack to bypass our built-in sanitizer. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 83, Firefox ESR < 78.5, and Thunderbird < 78.5.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26951` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '83.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
